questions.question: Mrs. Merriweather said "he" tried to do the right thing at the time, but it was wrong.  Who is he?

choices.answer: Atticus.
Tom Robinson.
Judge Taylor.
Bob Ewell

questions.question: Mrs. Merriweather is a hypocrite?  Provide an example.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: When Scout said Aunt Alexandra was echoing her 12 year old nephew, what did she mean?

choices.answer: She was mocking by repeating verbatim.
She was plagiarizing his ideas for her article.
Jem and Alexandra were both very upset by the same thing.
That Alexandra is coo coo for coo coo puffs.

questions.question: Why is the roly-poly put in the book?  How is it a motif for other characters?

choices.answer: It is easily crushed like our hopes and dreams.  Sad panda.
It is resilient and hard to detect, let alone kill.
It curls up into itself solipsistically and ignores reality.
It is a butterfly waiting to happen- like us.

questions.question: How does Tom Robinson symbolize a mockingbird?

choices.answer: He puts on the outfit that Cinna made for him.  It was lit.
Both are good, yet are harmed for no good reason.
He could not be contained- not even in death.
Bruh, that's deep.

questions.question: How does the current events part of class mirror Maycomb?

choices.answer: Barely literate people hardly able to function either way.
The class volunteers to solve current event problems.
Rules for thee, not for me.  Hitler=bad, I am good.
A teacher as judge arbitrarily assigning outcomes.

questions.question: On a scale of 1-1776, how much does Scout think Current Events accomplishes it's goals?

choices.answer: Negative 1776
Infinity
I'd give it about a 3.
She DIEEINBs on it.
Females
Males
Kids
Rational people with clear rules.

questions.question: How does Ms. Gates base her opinions on morality?

choices.answer: Correctly- she dislikes Hitler.
Hypocritically- dislikes Hitler then dislikes Tom Robinson.
Based on how it benefits her.
By the letter of the criminal law.

questions.question: Why do you think it's easier to judge other communities than our own?

choices.answer: We judge our own motives vs. their actions.
We are more directly affected by others than ourselves.
Blind spots are real and exist for a reason.
"Murdering one person is a tragedy, a million is a statistic."-Joe Stalin

questions.question: The point of reading this book is-

choices.answer: To ace the class- who cares.
To learn about history for its own sake.
Hopefully so history doesn't repeat itself.
To develop empathy, solidarity, and camaraderie.  Hooyah!
Tim Tebow
Bo Jackson
Patrick Mahomes II
Master Chief John-117
